results.title: Under the one roof
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
Some cultures such as the Australian Aboriginal, Western Samoan and Chinese still maintain traditions of respect and status for their older members. This film looks at some families in Australia (a country where the nuclear family is the norm) who are maintaining extended family life styles. Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.

results.title: With minimal help
results.creator_credit: James Ricketson, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
The need for independence does not diminish with age. There are a variety of community support systems now available to people who want to maintain maximum independence for as long as possible. This film considers a number of community support systems which point the way to the future: community-based health care and home help, group home living and retirement villages.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Ricketson, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia

results.title: The Nest egg
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Suzanne Baker, AMP Society and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
A dramatized re-enactment which highlights the options and dangers awaiting the newly retired who are dazzled by investment choices. Stresses the pitfalls that can await those people retiring with large sums of cash.

results.title: The Other side of the coin
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
It’s hard in an affluent society to make do just on the pension. A couple show how they manage- what they do without and their wry but courageous philosophy of life.

results.title: Age of Discovery
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Spanish and Portugese explorations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Age of Discovery”.
Scenes of Spanish and Portugese towns and photographs of statues, paintings, and other material of historical interest are used to provide a background to the exploration of new routes to the Orient and to the New World. Reference is made to the voyages of Prince Henry the Navigator, Columbus, Vasco Da Gama, Magellan, the Conquistadores, and others.

results.title: English, French and Dutch explorations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Age of Discovery”.
Outlines the reasons behind the explorations of Cabot, Verrazano, Cartier, Frobisher, Hudson, Drake and Raleigh, the routes followed, and how their expeditions affected North America. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Anansi the spider: a tale from the Ashanti
results.creator_credit: Gerald McDermott and Gerald McDermott Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “African folklore”.
Anansi is a folk hero of the Ashanti people of Ghana and is a spider with human qualities. In this tale he falls into a river and is swallowed by a fish. After his rescue another accident befalls him. Rescued again, Anansi wishes to reward his son who has helped him with the aid of a beautiful white globe. Nyame, the One god, resolves the dilemma for him by setting the globe in the sky: it is the moon. Animation by Vincent Bell and narrated by Athmani Magoma. Animation inspired by the sophisticated geometric forms of the Ashanti.

results.title: The Magic tree
results.creator_credit: Gerald McDermott and Landmark Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “African folklore”.
A haunting tale from the Congo about Movgumgu, a homely, unloved boy who leaves his family for a lonely river voyage. Relates his experiences with a Magic Tree which he finds in a river clearing.
